document.docAuthor: Wang, Junjie, Zhang, Yalin & Huang, Min
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the leafhopper genus Agnesiella Dworakowska (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae) from China, with descriptions of 13 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the leafhopper genus Agnesiella Dworakowska (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae) from China, with descriptions of 13 new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of
Agnesiella
from China

paragraph.keyLead:
3. Aedeagal shaft with incision on dorsal margin subapically in lateral view...............
A. ( A. ) buysi Dworakowska, 1982
- Aedeagal shaft without incision on dorsal margin subapically in lateral view...................................... 4

4. Paramere with subapical protrusion (Fig. 67).........................
A. ( A. ) marginata Dworakowska, 1994
rec. nov.

5. Paramere with caudal apex angle with upper subapical protrusion nearly equal to 90.....
A. ( A. ) juglandis Chou & Ma, 1981
- Paramere with caudal apex angle with upper subapical protrusion slightly less than 180°............................. 6

6. Pronotum with T-shaped blackish patch on central area...........................
A. ( A. ) nitobella ( Matsumura, 1932 )
- Pronotum without T-shaped blackish patch on central area..................................................... 7
7. Pronotum with single blackish patch on center of anterior margin............................................... 8

- Pronotum without single blackish patch on center of anterior margin...............
A. ( A. ) lyraeformis ( Matsumura, 1932 )

8. Pronotum with blackish patches on central area near posterior margin.............
A. ( A. ) matsumurai Dworakowska, 1982
- Pronotum without blackish patches on central area near posterior margin......................................... 9

9. Pronotum with pair of lateral blackish patches ( Fig. 10 ).......................
A. ( A. ) protensa Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Pronotum with 2 pairs of lateral blackish patches.................................
A. ( A. ) giranna ( Matsumura, 1932 )

10. Aedeagal shaft with ventral appendage nearly equal to 1/4 length of aedeagal shaft in lateral view ( Fig. 87 )...................................................................................
A. ( A. ) recurva Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Aedeagal shaft with ventral appendage nearly equal to 1/2 length of aedeagal shaft in lateral view ( Fig. 96 )....................................................................................
A. ( A. ) polita Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.
11. Pygofer side with setae near ventral margin basally......................................................... 12
- Pygofer side without setae near ventral margin basally....................................................... 15
12. Pygofer side with long fine setae near posterior margin...................................................... 13
- Pygofer side without long fine setae near posterior margin.................................................... 14

13. Aedeagal shaft with subapical ventral margin irregularly undulated....................
A. ( D. ) sinuata Yan & Yang, 2019

- Aedeagal shaft with subapical ventral margin not undulated ( Fig. 155 )..........
A. ( D. ) apiculata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

14. Ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft with 2 digitiform branches ( Fig. 141 ).........
A. ( D. ) exigua Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft with 1 digitiform branch.........................
A. ( D. ) latusa Yan & Yang, 2016

16. Pygofer appendage trifurcate ( Fig. 160 )...................................
A. ( D. ) tridigitata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Pygofer appendage bifurcate...................................................
A. ( D. ) rita Dworakowska, 1982
17. Pygofer appendage arising from posteroventral margin....................................................... 18
- Pygofer appendage arising from posterior margin........................................................... 26

18. Paramere with 2 subapical protrusions.........................................
A. ( D. ) roxana Dworakowska, 1982
19. Paramere with subapical protrusion nearly as long as caudal apex.............................................. 20
- Paramere with subapical protrusion small and distinctly shorter than caudal apex.................................. 22

20. Aedeagal shaft with bifurcate ventral appendage.....................................
A. ( D. ) furca Yan & Yang, 2019

21. Forewing with a dark brown patch at base ( Figs 33, 37 )........................
A. ( D. ) glabra Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Forewing without patch at base.................................................
A. ( D. ) innota Yan & Yang, 2019
22. Aedeagal shaft with a distinctly lamellar extension dorsally in lateral view....................................... 23

- Aedeagal shaft without lamellar extension dorsally in lateral view......................
A. ( D. ) azra Dworakowska, 1994
23. Aedeagal shaft with digitiform ventral appendage directed distad in lateral view.................................. 24
- Aedeagal shaft with digitiform ventral appendage directed basad in lateral view................................... 25

24. Aedeagal shaft with apex narrowing gradually in posterior view ( Fig. 182 )........
A. ( D. ) stipitata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Aedeagal shaft with subapex constricted in posterior view ( Fig. 113 )................
A. ( D. ) lata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

25. Digitiform ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft slightly less than 1/2 as long as aedeagal shaft in lateral view ( Fig. 112 )..........................................................................
A. ( D. ) gaura Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Digitiform ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft very short in lateral view.................
A. ( D. ) erosa Yan & Yang, 2016
26. Paramere with subapical protrusion nearly as long as caudal apex.............................................. 27
- Paramere with subapical protrusion small and distinct shorter than caudal apex................................... 28

27. Pygofer side with long fine setae near posteroventral margin ( Fig. 144 )............
A. ( D. ) mitrata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- Pygofer side without long fine setae near posteroventral margin...........................
A. ( D. ) aldera Thapa, 1984

28. Aedeagal shaft with distinctly lamellar extension dorsally in lateral view...............
A. ( D. ) xantha Yan & Yang, 2016
- Aedeagal shaft without distinctly lamellar extension dorsally in lateral view...................................... 29

29. Aedeagal shaft with ventral appendage lamellar ( Fig. 128 ).....................
A. ( D. ) eleganta Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.
- Aedeagal shaft with ventral appendage not lamellar......................................................... 30
- Aedeagal shaft with ventral appendage trifurcate........................................................... 32

31. Aedeagal shaft with middle part of dorsal margin serrated.............................
A. ( D. ) ela Dworakowska, 1977

- Aedeagal shaft with dorsal margin smooth........................................
A. ( D. ) digita Yan & Yang, 2019

32. In lateral view, three branches of ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft each arising separately from common stem ( Fig. 120 ).................................................................
A. ( D. ) longisagittata Huang & Zhang
sp. nov.

- In lateral view, 2 outer branches of ventral appendage of aedeagal shaft with common stem separate from innermost branch (Fig. 104)..........................................................
A. ( D. ) irma Dworakowska, 1977
rec. nov.
